Key Match Events: Rashid Khan played an unbeaten knock of 48 off 23 balls
Glenn Maxwell scored a fine half-century
Adam Zampa and Josh Hazlewood took two wickets each
Ibrahim Zadran and Gulbadin Naib started building a 59-run partnership
Glenn Maxwell ensured that it would not be the case with an outstanding direct hit from the deep to break the partnership
Pre-Game Insights: Australia needed Sri Lanka to beat England and if that happens, they are through to the semi-finals of the 2022 ICC Menâ€™s World Cup
Post-Match Reflections: Matthew Wade says that he had planned to finish the quota of other bowlers first and give Marcus Stoinis the final over
Mohammad Nabi says that it was a good game and Afghanistan started off well and played really well
Glenn Maxwell is the Player of the Match for his knock of 54(32)
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rashid Khan and the Afghans have put on quite a fight here but have sadly fallen just short of the finish line
The Australians did have quite a scare but their quality eventually came through and they sealed a 4-run win to go second in the Group 1 standings
